Module: pullRequests

Client. pullRequests

Source:
  • api/pullRequests.js, line 9

Methods

<static> pullRequests.create(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
title String
body String <optional>
base String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo.
head String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/pullRequests.js, line 110
Tutorials:
  • pullRequests.create

<static> pullRequests.createComment(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
number Number

Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
body String
commit_id String

Required string - Sha of the commit to comment on.
path String

Required string - Relative path of the file to comment on.
position Number

Required number - Column index in the diff to comment on.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.

<static> pullRequests.createFromIssue(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
issue Number

Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
base String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo.
head String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.

<static> pullRequests.getAll(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
state String <optional>

Validation rule: ^(open|closed)$.
page Number <optional>

Page number of the results to fetch. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
per_page Number <optional>

A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/pullRequests.js, line 65
Tutorials:
  • pullRequests.getAll
